SENT.plain: Although the past few decades have yielded significant improvements in the management of cardiomyopathy, heart failure remains a leading cause of hospitalization as well as readmissions, both in the United States and worldwide
Accurate assessment of volume status in these patients is of great importance because it guides initial therapies and aids in determining suitability for discharge
However, this assessment can prove to be challenging and, therefore, must be based on multiple data points and techniques
This review examines the various modalities of volume assessment in the patient with decompensated heart failure
